Package wei.task

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • wei.task.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    The task class represents a task with several properties, such as task name, project name, due time etc. It also implements the Serializable interface, so that the class can be used for object stream reader and writer.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Wei Wang
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Task()
      Constructor for objects of class Task, the default value of task status is "undo", default create time is current system time.
      Task​(int id)
      Constructor for objects of class Task with a given taskId, the default value of status is "undo", default create time is current system time, the project, taskName and dueTime are initialized to be null, user must to update those properties.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Set dueTime of the task.
      void setProject​(java.lang.String projectName)
      Set project name to a task, it can not be null or empty String, the projectName will be automatically trimmed.
      void setStatus​(java.lang.String status)
      Set the status of the task.

      Set the task id of the task.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task()
        Constructor for objects of class Task, the default value of task status is "undo", default create time is current system time. The taskId is initialized to be an invalid value(-1) and it needs the caller to update the taskId later on, the project, taskName and dueTime are initialized to be null, user must to update those properties.

      • Task

        public Task​(int id)
     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for objects of class Task with a given taskId, the default value of status is "undo", default create time is current system time, the project, taskName and dueTime are initialized to be null, user must to update those properties.
        Parameters:
        id - The task's id, which is a non-negative integer.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the id is a negative integer.

      • setDueTime

        public void setDueTime​(java.lang.String dueTime)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set dueTime of the task.
        Parameters:
        dueTime - A properly format String which will be set as due time, format has to be: "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss"
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified String format is invalid or the new time is smaller than the Task's create time.

      • setProject

        public void setProject​(java.lang.String projectName)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set project name to a task, it can not be null or empty String, the projectName will be automatically trimmed.
        Parameters:
        projectName - New project name of the task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified projectName is null or empty string.

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus​(java.lang.String status)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the status of the task.
        Parameters:
        status - New status of the task, a legal status is "undo" or "done" and it's case insensitive.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified status is null or not "undo" and "done"

      • setTaskId

        public void setTaskId​(int taskId)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the task id of the task.
        Parameters:
        taskId - New task id of the task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if task id is a negative integer

      • setTaskName

        public void setTaskName​(java.lang.String taskName)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set the new task name of a task, it can not be null or empty String, the taskName will be automatically trimmed.
        Parameters:
        taskName - new task name of the task
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the specified name is null or empty String.
